messages.content: Please upload the PDF file for the deck. Once uploaded, the process will continue.

slides.title: Advanced Wellness Plus Insurance Overview
slides.content: The slide presents the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' insurance plan, highlighting its association with American Financial Security Life Insurance Co. It features an image of a healthcare professional interacting with an elderly patient, suggesting a focus on health and wellness. The insurance is described as a Limited Benefit Health Insurance Plan, underwritten by American Financial Security Life Insurance Co., and is issued to the National Congress of Employers. The policy forms mentioned include AF FI Policy 721 and AFS LM 721 AWP BR.

slides.title: Advanced Wellness Plus Benefit Overview
slides.content: The slide presents a detailed benefits table for the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' plan, outlining various medical benefits and their corresponding coverage limits across different plan levels (100A, 100, 200, 200+, 300, 500, 750, 1000). Benefits include Hospital Confinement, Primary and Specialty Care Doctors Office Visits, Emergency Room, Basic Pathology & Radiology, Advance Studies, Surgery, Anesthesia, Mental Health (Inpatient and Outpatient), Supplemental Accident (Inpatient Admission and Emergency Room), Hospital Intensive Care Unit, Additional Hospital Admission, Accidental Death, and Critical Illness. Coverage amounts vary by plan level, with higher levels offering increased benefits. Notably, there is a 30-day waiting period for coverage, excluding injuries, and a 12-month exclusion for pre-existing conditions.

slides.title: Overview of Advanced Wellness Plus and NCE Membership
slides.content: The slide provides an overview of the Advanced Wellness Plus program, highlighting the role of the National Congress of Employers (NCE) in offering benefits to small and medium-sized businesses. It explains the membership process, including the receipt of a Purchase Confirmation email and the delivery of a membership packet and ID cards within 7-10 business days. The monthly membership involves a billing statement reflecting the premium for health benefits, with an initial non-refundable enrollment fee. Limited Medical Coverage is described as a plan that supplements major medical plans, offering basic insurance coverage with capped benefits. Eligibility is for adult members aged 18-65 and dependent children aged 1-25.

slides.title: Advanced Wellness Plus - GapAfford Plus Membership Benefits
slides.content: The slide outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, which offers savings on medical expenses without deductibles, pre-existing condition limitations, medical exams, claim forms, or age restrictions. It includes a prescription discount program with savings on brand-name and generic medications, and access to the Aetna Dental Access Network for dental care discounts. The OUTLOOK Vision Network provides savings on eyeglasses and contact lenses. Pet Rx offers discounts on pet medications. Alternative medicine, chiropractic care, and hearing savings programs are available, along with imaging savings and medical bill negotiations. Members can save on medical supplies, laboratory services, physical therapy, vitamins, and supplements. The program also includes a 24/7 health information line and nurse help line. Notably, the benefits are not insurance and are not available in certain states.

slides.title: Hospital Indemnity Insurance Limitations & Exclusions
slides.content: The slide outlines the limitations and exclusions of a hospital indemnity insurance policy. It specifies that benefits will not be provided for treatments, services, or supplies that are not medically necessary, not prescribed by a doctor, experimental, or provided by an immediate family member. Additional exclusions include dental procedures unless related to accidental injury, elective and cosmetic surgeries, felonies or illegal occupations, manipulations of the musculoskeletal system, self-inflicted injuries, war or service-related injuries, work-related injuries, and pre-existing conditions within 12 months of coverage. There is a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits, and no coverage for voluntary abortion unless life-threatening. Coverage provisions may vary by state. Claims can be mailed or electronically submitted to the specified addresses.

processed_summaries:
## Plan Overview

The "Advanced Wellness Plus" insurance plan is a Limited Benefit Health Insurance Plan underwritten by American Financial Security Life Insurance Co. It is designed to provide essential health and wellness benefits to its members, particularly focusing on small and medium-sized businesses through its association with the National Congress of Employers. This plan aims to supplement major medical plans by offering capped benefits for various healthcare services.

## Core Plan Elements

- **Key Features and Benefits:**
  - Comprehensive medical benefits across multiple tiers.
  - Coverage for hospital confinement, office visits, emergency room services, mental health, and more.
  - Additional benefits like accidental death and critical illness coverage.

- **Coverage Details:**
  - Benefits vary significantly across the different plan tiers, with higher tiers offering greater coverage amounts.
  - A 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and a 12-month exclusion for pre-existing conditions apply.

- **Eligibility Requirements:**
  - Available to adult members aged 18-65 and dependent children aged 1-25.

## Common Service Features

- **Network Access:**
  - Access to the Aetna Dental Access Network for dental care discounts.
  - Prescription discount program and OUTLOOK Vision Network for optical savings.

- **Claims Process:**
  - Easy claim submission through mail or electronic means.
  - Support for medical bill negotiations.

- **Support Services:**
  - 24/7 health information line and nurse help line to assist members.
  - Savings on alternative medicine, chiropractic care, and hearing programs.

## Plan Tiers and Benefits

### Plan Tier 100A

**Hospital Confinement Benefit**
- Per Day: $100
- Maximum Days: 30

**Primary Care Doctors Office Visit Benefit**
- Per Day: $50
- Maximum Days: 3

**Specialty Care Doctors' Office Visit Benefit**
- Per Day: $50
- Maximum Days: 3

**Accidental Death Benefit**
- Maximum Benefit: Not Applicable

**Critical Illness**
- Maximum Benefit: Not Applicable

### Plan Tier 100

**Hospital Confinement Benefit**
- Per Day: $100
- Maximum Days: 30

**Primary Care Doctors Office Visit Benefit**
- Per Day: $50
- Maximum Days: 5

**Specialty Care Doctors' Office Visit Benefit**
- Per Day: $50
- Maximum Days: 5

**Emergency Room Benefit**
- Per Day: Not Applicable
- Maximum Days: Not Applicable

**Accidental Death Benefit**
- Maximum Benefit: $10,000

**Critical Illness**
- Maximum Benefit: $1,000

### Plan Tier 200 (1/2)

## Comparison of the Plans

| **Feature** | **100A** | **100** | **200** | **200+** | **300** | **500** | **750** | **1000** |
|-------------|----------|---------|---------|----------|---------|---------|---------|----------|
| Hospital Confinement | $100 | $100 | $200 | $200 | $300 | $500 | $750 | $1000 |
| Primary Care Visit | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $75 |
| Specialty Care Visit | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 | $75 | $100 |
| Emergency Room | - | - | - | $50 | $50 | $50 | $75 | $75 |
| Pathology & Radiology | - | - | $50 | $50 | - | $50 | $50 | $75 |
| Advance Studies | - | - | $50 | $50 | - | $50 | $50 | $75 |
| Surgery | - | - | $400 | $400 | $750 | $1000 | $1500 | $1500 |
| Anesthesia | - | - | 20% | 20% | 20% | 20% | 20% | 20% |
| Mental Health Inpatient | - | - | - | - | $150 | $250 | $375 | $500 |
| Mental Health Outpatient | - | - | - | - | $50 | $50 | $50 | $50 |
| Accidental Death | - | $10,000 | $10,000 | $10,000 | $10,000 | $10,000 | $10,000 | $10,000 |
| Critical Illness | - | $1,000 | $1,000 | $1,000 | $1,000 | $1,000 | $1,000 | $1,000 |

## Limitations and Definitions

- **Important Exclusions:**
  - No coverage for treatments not medically necessary or prescribed.
  - Excludes dental procedures unrelated to accidental injury, cosmetic surgeries, and experimental treatments.
  - Excludes injuries related to war, self-inflicted harm, or illegal activities.
  - 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and a 12-month exclusion for pre-existing conditions.

- **Key Terms Defined:**
  - **Hospital Confinement:** Coverage for each day a plan member is confined to a hospital.
  - **Primary Care Visit:** Benefits for visits to a primary healthcare provider.
  - **Specialty Care Visit:** Coverage for consultations with specialist providers.
  - **Emergency Room:** Benefits for emergency room visits due to acute medical conditions.

## Key Takeaways

- **Plan Highlights:**
  - Wide range of healthcare benefits designed to provide financial support across various medical needs.
  - Multiple plan tiers allow for flexibility in selecting coverage levels that match individual or family needs.

- **Value Propositions:**
  - Affordable option to supplement major medical insurance with capped benefits.
  - Valuable discounts and savings programs enhance the value of membership.

- **Next Steps:**
  - Review the specific benefits and limitations of each plan tier to determine the best fit for your healthcare needs.
  - Consider enrollment, keeping in mind eligibility requirements and waiting periods.
